trend_summary: Over the series, dark woodland patches steadily shrink while light-toned cropland expands, especially in the centre and south. Road corridors lengthen and interconnect, yet settlement footprints remain scattered and small. Overall, the landscape evolves toward an open agricultural mosaic with only modest increases in built area.
notable_changes: Progressive reduction of forest cover, most evident in the north-west and central belts.
Consolidation and enlargement of rectangular cropland parcels throughout the interior.
New eastâ€“west arterial road and several feeder tracks appear, tightening the transport grid.
Small hamlets grow slightly along main roads, but no major urban core develops.
Possible new quarry or open-pit extraction site emerges in the south-west quadrant.
